title: The Summit Yielded No Ceasefire Agreement for Trump, Putin, or Ukraine
summary: In Alaska, a summit involving Donald Trump, Vladimir Putin, and representatives from Ukraine concluded without a ceasefire agreement or any substantial deal, prolonging uncertainty in the ongoing conflict. BBC correspondents assessed the meeting, revealing little progress towards de-escalation, as key players failed to find common ground. The meeting took place against the backdrop of the continuing War in Ukraine, where Ukrainian soldiers are actively engaged in Donetsk region. Observers are now closely watching for any shifts in strategy from the involved parties.

title: Israel Is Preparing for a Nationwide Strike to Advocate for Hostages
text: Nearly two years of demonstrations have failed to push Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to reach a deal with Hamas that would end the war and free the remaining captives.
summary: Public pressure mounts on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as widespread demonstrations demand he negotiate a ceasefire agreement with Hamas to secure the release of hostages, highlighting deep divisions within Israel over the government's handling of the ongoing conflict. The protests underscore the failure of Netanyahu's current strategy to achieve these objectives through military means alone. These persistent demonstrations, spanning almost two years, reflect the growing frustration of Israeli citizens, including families of the captives, with Netanyahu's leadership and the prolonged war. The situation emphasizes the difficult position Netanyahu occupies, balancing security concerns with the urgent need to bring hostages home amid increasing domestic and international scrutiny.

title: Mali's Junta Accuses a French Citizen of Planning to Overthrow the Government
text: A representative of the junta said the man had worked “on behalf of the French intelligence service, which mobilized political leaders, civil society actors and military personnel” to foment a coup.
summary: Myanmar's junta accused an individual of collaborating with French intelligence to orchestrate a coup, alleging the person mobilized political figures, civil society groups, and military staff; this accusation signifies the junta's continued efforts to consolidate power and suppress dissent. By claiming foreign interference, the junta aims to delegitimize internal opposition and justify its authoritarian rule. France has yet to respond publicly to the accusations. The arrest comes amid ongoing political instability and violent crackdowns in Myanmar following the military coup in 2021.
